page.title: 02Our Lost Tree
page.content: Hutton Rudby has a main road.On either side there are big trees. Some of these were Elms which had to be cut down because they had Dutch Elm Disease. They planted some more in their place which were a Horse Chestnut, a Beech, an Oak and a Rowan. Classes three and four went on Thurs 7 March 1985 to the planting it was lucky that all the trees on the green were not all Elms because if they were Elms they would have all had to be cut down! Leven House is one of the largest houses in Hutton Rudby,it was built in 1811. It's carved into window-sill. The ceiling is about 5 metres high with a pretty decoration. I think it was the rectory originally even though it had a sign on the door saying "This is not the Rectory". It is for sale now at Â£100,000.
